entry.title: HTTPURLLOC for View Designer
entry.content:
When going to SE80 and opening a Webdynpro view (Layout tab), it is using our wildcard /WEBDYNPRO/* rule in HTTPURLLOC to render the preview. We are wanting to add an entry so that it uses the normal application server hostname. Can you please advise what the entry / context for this would be?

entry.title: logoff and redirect login prompt does not work
entry.content:
Hello

We have a service in ITS Mobile, this service work fine, but when we try a logoff, the session ended successfully, but does not offer the option to re-enter credentials. (log off and Redirect to login prompt).

This is a problem for us, this browser is used by a radio frequency device, which needs to continually change users.

Services in SICF transaction are active.

/sap/bc/gui/sap/its/zlm00

/sap/public/bc/icf/logoff

thansk in advance.

BR.

entry.title: Issue with Passing FREE SELECTIONS in SUBMIT Without VIA SELECTION-SCREEN
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am working on an SAP ABAP program where I need to pass dynamic profit center values (PRCTR) to a report using FREE SELECTIONS. Below is a snippet of my code:

LOOP AT s_values INTO lv_prctr_value.
trange_line-tablename = 'FAGLFREESEL'.
trange_frange_t_line-fieldname = 'PRCTR'.
trange_frange_t_selopt_t_line-sign = 'I'.
trange_frange_t_selopt_t_line-option = 'EQ'.
trange_frange_t_selopt_t_line-low = lv_prctr_value.
IF lv_prctr_value IS NOT INITIAL.
APPEND trange_frange_t_selopt_t_line TO trange_frange_t_line-selopt_t.
ENDIF.
ENDLOOP.

APPEND trange_frange_t_line TO trange_line-frange_t.
APPEND trange_line TO trange.

CALL FUNCTION 'FREE_SELECTIONS_RANGE_2_EX'
EXPORTING
field_ranges = trange
IMPORTING
expressions = texpr.

SUBMIT ZTEST017 "VIA SELECTION-SCREEN 
WITH SELECTION-TABLE rspar_tab
WITH B-MONATE BETWEEN lv_num AND lv_bilabmon
WITH B-MONATE IN range_tab
WITH V-MONATE BETWEEN lv_num AND lv_bilabmon
WITH V-MONATE IN range_tab
WITH FREE SELECTIONS texpr
  EXPORTING LIST TO MEMORY
  AND RETURN.




The Problem:

When I execute the program with the VIA SELECTION-SCREEN option in the SUBMIT command, my custom profit center (PRCTR) values are passed correctly, and I get the desired report output. However, when I execute the program without VIA SELECTION-SCREEN, the report generates output for all profit centers instead of just my custom values.

What I’ve Tried:

  • Verified that teexpr contains the correct values for the FREE SELECTIONS.
  • Used VIA SELECTION-SCREEN, which works but requires manual user interaction.
  • Attempted to directly pass the profit center values without the selection screen, but they are ignored.

My Requirement:

I need the report to honor the custom FREE SELECTIONS for the profit center (PRCTR) even when the program is run without the VIA SELECTION-SCREEN option.

Question:

How can I ensure that my custom FREE SELECTIONS for PRCTR are correctly passed to the report in the SUBMIT command when running the program without VIA SELECTION-SCREEN?

Any guidance or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: is/SMTP/virt_host_X for more than 9 clients not possible
entry.content:
Hello,

we are consolidating our SAP-Systems for the jump to S4/HANA. During consolidation we consider to unify several systems into one system with multiple clients.

The actual system (PS1) already has 9 cleints and more need to be imported to reduce the complexity of the system landscape. However, it seems not possible to have more than 9 clients in the system due to restrictions of the ICM: It is not possible to configure more than 9 "is/smtp/virt_host_X"-items to enable receive of Emails in the clients.

Can you provide me with information to allow more than 9 "is/SMTP/virt_host_X"-items configured?

I already tried to define "is/SMTP/virt_host_10", which is possible via RZ10, but the parameter is not usable in SICF.

Best regards,

Jürgen

entry.title: Get the data from RFC BAPI Result
entry.content:
Hi Everyone

The third-party application is sending data to SAP Standard RFC BAPI parameter, then the BAPI will prepare a data then extract it / send it to third party application

My question is how to view the RFC BAPI received data and sent to third party application without any code modification? is there a log history of data received/sent in SAP or tcode I can use to view the received/sent data?


Like for example: these BAPI parameters was sent to third party application yesterday after a week I want to review/check the data sent to third party application

entry.title: S2S VPN requirement?
entry.content:
Hello Experts:

I have inserted two images here for my question. 

Our client is an existing SAP customer (installed base) on ECC. They are moving to RISE with SAP and are raising questions about the requirement for a S2S VPN connection - as shown here from "Customer Premise" in the upper left hand corner.

They want to know WHY it a S2S VPN is mandatory. They would prefer not to have to use one. 

This customer would prefer to explore THIS option.

The reason why they prefer this option is that they do not want to have remote users - i.e. those working from home or in their offices and already "in the cloud" - to have to activate a VPN before logging into their SAP environment on RISE. 

Why is a S2S VPN mandatory? 

Thank you in advance

Dan Magni

Daniel.Magni@Ameri100.com

entry.title: Passing data from one session to another session
entry.content:
Hi,

I need to pass data from one LUW to another in my SAP system. Initially, I tried using Memory ID, but I encountered issues when multiple sessions attempted to update the same Memory ID simultaneously.

In my system, Shared Memory is not allowed, so I am exploring other options. I am considering using a persistence mechanism, but I don’t want to create a custom Z table to store the data.

Is there a way to achieve this using standard SAP features, such as persistent objects, temporary cluster tables, or any other alternatives?

Thanks in advance for your suggestions!

entry.title: Restricting Duplicate Notifications for Same Equipment
entry.content:
If a notification is created, first check whether a previous notification exists for the same equipment. If an open notification already exists, restrict the creation of a new one notification.

To implement this logic, I have tried using a user exit with the procedure mentioned below. Can you suggest whether this logic will work smoothly?"

User Exit and Logic for Restriction

In the QQMA0002 & QQMA0026   user exit you will use the VIQMEL table to query existing notifications and restrict new ones based on equipment.

User Exit: (QQMA0002 & QQMA0026):

Steps to Implement the Restriction Logic:

  1. Query the VIQMEL table
    • Use VIQMEL-EQUNR (Equipment Number) to find existing notifications.
    • Filter by QMART (Notification Type) is necessary.
    • Retrieve OBJNR (Object Number) from the result.
  2. Check Status in JEST Table
    • Use OBJNR to fetch the status from JEST table.
    • Filter with INACT field:
      • If INACT is blank (Active) → Restrict notification creation.
      • If INACT is 'X' (Inactive) → Allow creation.
  3. Prevent Notification Creation
    • If restriction applies, use MESSAGE statement to show an error message.

                                                     ⬇️ 

             Already have created same equipment Notification

 

Logic Description (Step-by-Step):

  1. Find Existing 'M2' Notifications: Retrieve all notifications from the VIQMEL table where EQUNR matches the equipment number and QMART is 'M2'.
  2. Check Status (JEST): For each notification found in step 1, retrieve the corresponding status from the JEST table using the OBJNR.
  3. Determine Activity: For each JEST entry:
    • If INACT is blank (space), the notification is considered active.
    • If INACT is 'X', the notification is considered inactive.
  4. Apply Restriction:
    • If at least one active 'M2' notification is found in step 3, prevent the creation of the new 'M2' notification and display an error message.
    • If all existing 'M2' notifications are inactive (INACT = 'X') or no 'M2' notifications exist (step 1 returned no results), allow the creation of the new 'M2' notification.

PLM Enterprise Asset Management (EAM)/Plant Maintenance (PM) SAP Asset Performance Management MM (Materials Management)

entry.title: Intermittent Http_Communication_Failure Error in ABAP Using IF_HTTP_CLIENT->receive
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am intermittently encountering the exception Http_Communication_Failure in my ABAP code when using the method IF_HTTP_CLIENT->receive to send data to external systems (in my case, SAP CPI).

Upon analyzing the short dump, I noticed the following error message:
Connect to hostaddress:443 failed: NIECONN_REFUSED (-10),
and the system variable ME->M_ECODE has the value 411.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue or have any suggestions on how to resolve this?

Thanks in advance,
Ravi Bharti

entry.title: Determine SAP UI5 Fiori runtime context in core ABAP logic and NOT under handler or odata service
entry.content:
Hello, Hope everyone is doing well. 

I am looking for a utility (class, FM etc) to determine if the logic is being executed withing SAP UI5 Fiori runtime context. Please note I don't have any control on the call stack from were the initial execution begin so please don't recommend/suggest using HTTP handler or odata service to get the context. 

I am using FM: GUI_IS_AVAILABLE to check if its GUI context and similarly, FM: WEBGUI_IS_IN_FLP and FM: ITS_IMPORT_CONTEXT to determine if a classic GUI is launched within FLP. Now I understand if not either it can be considered as Fiori runtime but sorry I don't want to take that approach and need something concrete that will help determine Fiori Runtime and also help provide the FQDN and the URL parameters. FM: ITS_IMPORT_CONTEXT is a good finding but unfortunately it only works when I access a Classic GUI app on FLP and not when a standard SAP UI5 Fiori App. 

Appreciate any feedback or recommendation to the problem statement. Apparently, most of the responses received from LLMs felt like they all are hallucinating and sorry I don't have Joule Chat enabled so can't ask Joule at the moment. 

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SECM_CONFIGURATION ends with ICM_HTTP_CONNECTION_BROKEN
entry.content:
Hi community,

while configuring ETD connections from S/4-system DM4 to ETD logcollector (running in kubernetes) when testing with "ping streaming" it ends with the message "HTTP Connectivity error: Connection to server broken (ICM_HTTP_CONNECTION_BROKEN).

On OS-level of application server DNS resolution works, as well as curl -vvk <hostname>:9095/1/version

entry.title: Does SAP recommend to have same PSE for both SAP SSL Server Standard and SAP SSL Client ?
entry.content: Does SAP recommend to have same PSE for both SAP SSL Server Standard and SAP SSL Client Standard in STRUST ? Can we copy the SSL Server PSE to SSL Client Standard ? If so, is this recommended by SAP ?
